history.content:
Course waitlists are processed as gsi hiring happens to be able to accommodate larger class sizes using the priorities described here: http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Policies/enrollment.shtml 

186, 188 and other courses had indeed processed their waitlists earlier and its also true that newly declared majors were admitted to both of those courses in the last couple of days.  There was significantly more capacity to do so in 188 than in 186 which is standard and is the experience every newly declared class of majors experiences.  It is certainly frustrating but it is also not unfair.

If you need help figuring out backup plans and/or sussing out your chances for still getting into 186, feel free to email me directly or call or stop by.

Michael-David 643-6002  sasson@berkeley.edu

Why was CS 186 waitlist processed before Winter 2015 CS major applications were processed? This didn't allow us to get into the class even though we Phase 2ed it and would've gotten in as we all just got declared.

CS 188 and the other courses didn't process their waitlist yet, so this is a bit unfair to the people who submitted CS declarations who wanted to get into the class.
history.subject: CS 186 Waitlist
